text: Prince Harry accepted Attitude magazine's Legacy Award on behalf of his mother, Princess Diana, tonight. The publication, known as UK's leading gay magazine ( Prince William became the first royal to grace its cover last year ), recognized the late Princess for her charity work with people suffering from AIDS. In his speech — nearly two months after the 20th anniversary of his mother's death — Harry remembered the famous moment when Diana shook hands with an AIDS patient in the late'80s, thus challenging stigmas against those suffering with the illness. ` ` In April 1987, my mother was only 25 years old,'' he began. ` ` She was still finding her way in public life, but already she felt a responsibility to shine her spotlight on the people and issues that were often ignored.
